intro: Romulea longituba, commonly known as the long-stemmed romulea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces a single, upright flower spike that bears several pale yellow to greenish-white blooms. Its bulbs are adapted for storage and survival in dry conditions, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. Romulea longituba is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique floral display.
